de.ntcomputer.minecraft.controllablemobs.api

Interface ControllableMobAI<E extends LivingEntity>


  • public interface ControllableMobAI<E extends LivingEntity>
    This interface lets you control and modify the entities AI. You can retrieve an instance by using ControllableMob.getAI()
    Version:
    v5
    Author:
    Cybran

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <B extends AIBehavior<? super E>> 
      AIPart<E,B>      		 addBehavior(B behavior)
      Adds a given AI behavior - the entity will act corresponding to this behavior.

      Adds the given AI behaviors.
      void clear()
      Removes all AI behaviors.
      AIPart<E,?>[] getParts()
      Retrieves all AI parts, including custom behaviors and default behaviors.

      Retrieves all AI parts, including custom behaviors and default behaviors of a specific type.

      Checks whether a behavior of the given type exists.

      Unattaches all AI parts of the specified types.
      void removeExcept(AIType... typesToKeep)
      Unattaches all AI parts that are NOT of the specified types.
      void reset()

    • Method Detail

      • addBehavior

        <B extends AIBehavior<? super E>> AIPart<E,B> addBehavior(B behavior)
                                                                           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a given AI behavior - the entity will act corresponding to this behavior.
        AI behaviors start certain actions automatically, defined by the behavior you add.
        You can retrieve an AI behavior instance by creating a subclass of AIBehavior.
        You can add the passed behavior to more than one entity.
        Parameters:
        behavior - the new AI behavior
        Returns:
        an AI part representing the behavior. You can use it to inspect or temporarily remove the behavior later.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when behavior is null

      • addBehaviors

        AIPart<E,?>[] addBehaviors(AIBehavior<? super E>... behaviors)
                                                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Adds the given AI behaviors.
        Parameters:
        behaviors - multiple new AI behaviors
        Returns:
        an array of AI parts. The parts are ordered similar to the behavior order in the behaviors array.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when behaviors is null or contains null
        See Also:
        addBehavior(AIBehavior)

      • remove

        void remove(AIType... typesToRemove)
        Unattaches all AI parts of the specified types.
        You are free to re-attach any of the removed AI parts later.
        Parameters:
        typesToRemove - multiple AI types. Any AI part of a type contained in this array will be unattached.

      • removeExcept

        void removeExcept(AIType... typesToKeep)
        Unattaches all AI parts that are NOT of the specified types.
        You are free to re-attach any of the removed AI parts later.
        Parameters:
        typesToKeep - multiple AI types. Any AI part of a type that is NOT contained in this array will be unattached.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Removes all AI behaviors.
        Removes custom, manually added behaviors as well as default behaviors.
        The result: the entity will not move nor attack automatically.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets to default AI behaviors.
        Removes custom, manually added behaviors and restores the default behaviors for this entity.
        The result: the entity will act normal.

      • getParts

        AIPart<E,?>[] getParts()
        Retrieves all AI parts, including custom behaviors and default behaviors.
        Returns:
        an array of all custom and default AI parts. Use it to inspect or remove specific parts.

      • getPartsOf

        AIPart<E,?>[] getPartsOf(AIType... types)
        Retrieves all AI parts, including custom behaviors and default behaviors of a specific type.
        Parameters:
        types - the filter types
        Returns:
        an array of all AI parts that have one of the types you specified.

      • hasBehavior

        boolean hasBehavior(AIType type)
        Checks whether a behavior of the given type exists.
        Parameters:
        type - the type to check for
        Returns:
        true, if this mob has an AI behavior of the specified type, and false otherwise
